comment.text: Functions as an activator of NOX1, a superoxide-producing NADPH oxidase. Functions in the production of reactive oxygen species (ROS) which participate in a variety of biological processes including host defense, hormone biosynthesis, oxygen sensing and signal transduction. May also activate CYBB/gp91phox and NOX3.

NOX1, NOXA1, NOXO1, RAC1 and CYBA forms a functional multimeric complex supporting ROS production. Interaction with YWHAZ prevents the interaction of NOXA1 with NOXO1 and RAC1 and its targeting to membranes, hence reducing its ability to activate NOX1. Interacts (via N-terminus) with SH3PXD2A and SH3PXD2B; the interaction is direct.
Translocation to membranes depends on NOXO1 or NCF1 and maybe RAC1.
Widely expressed. Detected in pancreas, liver, kidney, spleen, prostate, small intestine and colon.
The SH3 domain mediates interaction with NOXO1 and NCF1 and has autoregulatory function.
The TPR repeats mediate interaction with RAC1.
Interaction with YWHAZ depends on phosphorylation by PKA.
Mostly inactive for NOX1 activation. Does not interact with NOXO1.

property.value: Expressed in cerebellar vermis and 194 other tissues
P:regulation of hydrogen peroxide metabolic process

feature.description: Found in a truncated form isolated from Caco-2 cells treated with butyrate.
Loss of function and loss of interaction with RAC1.
Loss of function and loss of interaction with RAC1. Loss of localization to membranes.
Loss of phosphorylation. Loss of interaction with YHAWZ; when associated with A-461.
Constitutively interacts with YWHAZ; when associated with E-461.
Loss of interaction with NOXO1 and NCF1. Loss of localization to membranes. Partial loss of function.
Loss of phosphorylation. Loss of interaction with YHAWZ; when associated with A-172.
Constitutively interacts with YWHAZ; when associated with E-172.
